column4: I just downloaded the tar.gz file of Eclipse, how can I install it on ubuntu ?
I suggest you install the ubuntu package instead
how to install the ubuntu package & where will it be installed ?
make sure you have enabled apt-get to use the universe repo, and then it's installable via apt-get, aptitude, synaptic, etc.
i have the repositories enabled as I've installed the JDK earlier, but tell me where can I know about the apt-get command to install eclipse ?
these commands should be available somewhere for us to see and not ask here
it's just like installing any other package
that was a mistake ;)  I meant to type "^^"
apt-cache search <term> can help you find things
but, as nalioth suggests, synaptic is a nice GUI from which you can search as well
I don't see the SDK in the search results, I searched in synaptic as well before asking here
it's not under package management.  Using official packages is more efficient, easier, and preferred
no, you'll still get security updates
no, I'd say you're on the right track with eclipse
mp3s are not "run" (they're not binary executables)
